definition.name: Hermit
definition.description:
You lived in seclusion — either in a sheltered community such as a monastery, or entirely alone — for a formative part of your life. In your time apart from the clamor of society, you found quiet, solitude, and perhaps some of the answers you were looking for.

 

Skill Proficiencies: Medicine, Religion
Tool Proficiencies: Herbalism kit
Languages: One of your choice
Equipment: A scroll case stuffed full of notes from your studies or prayers, a winter blanket, a set of common clothes, an herbalism kit, and 5 gp

 
Life of Seclusion

What was the reason for your isolation, and what changed to allow you to end your solitude? You can work with your DM to determine the exact nature of your seclusion, or you can choose or roll on the table below to determine the reason behind your seclusion.

d8 Life of Seclusion
1 I was searching for spiritual enlightenment.
2 I was partaking of communal living in accordance with the dictates of a religious order.
3 I was exiled for a crime I didn’t commit.
4 I retreated from society after a life-altering event.
5 I needed a quiet place to work on my art, literature, music, or manifesto.
6 I needed to commune with nature, far from civilization.
7 I was the caretaker of an ancient ruin or relic.
8 I was a pilgrim in search of a person, place, or relic of spiritual significance.


FEATURE: DISCOVERY 

The quiet seclusion of your extended hermitage gave you access to a unique and powerful discovery. The exact nature of this revelation depends on the nature of your seclusion. It might be a great truth about the cosmos, the deities, the powerful beings of the outer planes, or the forces of nature. It could be a site that no one else has ever seen. You might have uncovered a fact that has long been forgotten, or unearthed some relic of the past that could rewrite history. It might be information that would be damaging to the people who consigned you to exile, and hence the reason for your return to society.

Work with your DM to determine the details of your discovery and its impact on the campaign.

 
Other Hermits

This hermit background assumes a contemplative sort of seclusion that allows room for study and prayer. If you want to play a rugged wilderness recluse who lives off the land while shunning the company of other people, look at the outlander background. On the other hand, if you want to go in a more religious direction, the acolyte might be what you’re looking for. Or you could even be a charlatan, posing as a wise and holy person and letting pious fools support you.

 
Suggested Characteristics

Some hermits are well suited to a life of seclusion, whereas others chafe against it and long for company. Whether they embrace solitude or long to escape it, the solitary life shapes their attitudes and ideals. A few are driven slightly mad by their years apart from society.

d8 Personality Trait
1 I’ve been isolated for so long that I rarely speak, preferring gestures and the occasional grunt.
2 I am utterly serene, even in the face of disaster.
3 The leader of my community had something wise to say on every topic, and I am eager to share that wisdom.
4 I feel tremendous empathy for all who suffer.
5 I’m oblivious to etiquette and social expectations.
6 I connect everything that happens to me to a grand, cosmic plan.
7 I often get lost in my own thoughts and contemplation, becoming oblivious to my surroundings.
8 I am working on a grand philosophical theory and love sharing my ideas.
d6 Ideal
1 Greater Good. My gifts are meant to be shared with all, not used for my own benefit. (Good)
2 Logic. Emotions must not cloud our sense of what is right and true, or our logical thinking. (Lawful)
3 Free Thinking. Inquiry and curiosity are the pillars of progress. (Chaotic)
4 Power. Solitude and contemplation are paths toward mystical or magical power. (Evil)
5 Live and Let Live. Meddling in the affairs of others only causes trouble. (Neutral)
6 Self-Knowledge. If you know yourself, there’s nothing left to know. (Any)
d6 Bond
1 Nothing is more important than the other members of my hermitage, order, or association.
2 I entered seclusion to hide from the ones who might still be hunting me. I must someday confront them.
3 I’m still seeking the enlightenment I pursued in my seclusion, and it still eludes me.
4 I entered seclusion because I loved someone I could not have.
5 Should my discovery come to light, it could bring ruin to the world.
6 My isolation gave me great insight into a great evil that only I can destroy.
d6 Flaw
1 Now that I’ve returned to the world, I enjoy its delights a little too much.
2 I harbor dark, bloodthirsty thoughts that my isolation and meditation failed to quell.
3 I am dogmatic in my thoughts and philosophy.
4 I let my need to win arguments overshadow friendships and harmony.
5 I’d risk too much to uncover a lost bit of knowledge.
6 I like keeping secrets and won’t share them with anyone.

race.description:
Like owls, owlin are graced with feathers that make no sound when they move or fly, making it easy for them to sneak up on you in the library.

Racial Traits
Darkvision, Flight, Silent Feathers

definition.name: Ability Score Increases
definition.description:
When determining your character’s ability scores, increase one of those scores by 2 and increase a different score by 1, or increase three different scores by 1. Follow this rule regardless of the method you use to determine the scores, such as rolling or point buy.

The “Quick Build” section for your character’s class offers suggestions on which scores to increase. You’re free to follow those suggestions or to ignore them. Whichever scores you decide to increase, none of the scores can be raised above 20.
definition.snippet: When determining your character’s ability scores, increase one score by 2 and increase a different score by 1, or increase three different scores by 1.

definition.name: Languages
definition.description: Your character can speak, read, and write Common and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for the character. The Player’s Handbook offers a list of widespread languages to choose from. The DM is free to add or remove languages from that list for a particular campaign.
definition.snippet: Your character can speak, read, and write Common and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for the character.

definition.name: Creature Type
definition.description: You are a Humanoid.
definition.snippet: You are a Humanoid.

definition.name: Size
definition.description: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.
definition.snippet: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

definition.name: Speed
definition.description: Your walking speed is 30 feet.
definition.snippet: Your walking speed is 30 ft.

definition.name: Darkvision
definition.description: You can see in dim light within 120 feet of yourself as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.
definition.snippet: You can see in dim light within 120 ft. of yourself as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

definition.name: Flight
definition.description: Thanks to your wings, you have a [rule]flying[/rule] speed equal to your walking speed. You can’t use this flying speed if you’re wearing medium or heavy armor.
definition.snippet: You have a flying speed equal to your walking speed. You can’t use this flying speed if you’re wearing medium or heavy armor.

definition.name: Silent Feathers
definition.description: You have proficiency in the Stealth skill.
definition.snippet: You have proficiency in the Stealth skill.

notes.backstory:
I come from a small sheltered-off community. The only people I know have lived here are the ones still here as there's rarely any newcomers to our area.

As I were doing the usual daily routine, I noticed some unfamiliar creatures hovering around. They explained they come from the south just exploring the forest and mountains nearby. I followed them back to their own home where I met Dai-in, which helped me explore a world beyond my own.

definition.name: Bag of Holding
definition.description:
This bag has an interior space considerably larger than its outside dimensions, roughly 2 feet in diameter at the mouth and 4 feet deep. The bag can hold up to 500 pounds, not exceeding a volume of 64 cubic feet. The bag weighs 15 pounds, regardless of its contents. Retrieving an item from the bag requires an action.

If the bag is overloaded, pierced, or torn, it ruptures and is destroyed, and its contents are scattered in the Astral Plane. If the bag is turned inside out, its contents spill forth, unharmed, but the bag must be put right before it can be used again. Breathing creatures inside the bag can survive up to a number of minutes equal to 10 divided by the number of creatures (minimum 1 minute), after which time they begin to suffocate.

Placing a bag of holding inside an extradimensional space created by a handy haversack, portable hole, or similar item instantly destroys both items and opens a gate to the Astral Plane. The gate originates where the one item was placed inside the other. Any creature within 10 feet of the gate is sucked through it to a random location on the Astral Plane. The gate then closes. The gate is one-way only and can’t be reopened.

definition.name: Handaxe
definition.description: Proficiency with a handaxe allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.

properties.name: Light
properties.description: A light weapon is small and easy to handle, making it ideal for use when fighting with two weapons.

properties.name: Thrown
properties.description: If a weapon has the thrown property, you can throw the weapon to make a ranged attack. If the weapon is a melee weapon, you use the same ability modifier for that attack roll and damage roll that you would use for a melee attack with the weapon. For example, if you throw a handaxe, you use your Strength, but if you throw a dagger, you can use either your Strength or your Dexterity, since the dagger has the finesse property.

definition.name: Dart
definition.description: Proficiency with a dart allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.

properties.name: Finesse
properties.description: When making an attack with a finesse weapon, you use your choice of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls. You must use the same modifier for both rolls.

properties.name: Thrown
properties.description: If a weapon has the thrown property, you can throw the weapon to make a ranged attack. If the weapon is a melee weapon, you use the same ability modifier for that attack roll and damage roll that you would use for a melee attack with the weapon. For example, if you throw a handaxe, you use your Strength, but if you throw a dagger, you can use either your Strength or your Dexterity, since the dagger has the finesse property.

definition.name: Shortbow
definition.description: Proficiency with a shortbow allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.

properties.name: Ammunition
properties.description:
You can use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack (you need a free hand to load a one-handed weapon). At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield. 
If you use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a melee attack, you treat the weapon as an improvised weapon (see "Improvised Weapons" later in the section). A sling must be loaded to deal any damage when used in this way.

properties.name: Range
properties.description: A weapon that can be used to make a ranged attack has a range in parentheses after the ammunition or thrown property. The range lists two numbers. The first is the weapon's normal range in feet, and the second indicates the weapon's long range. When attacking a target beyond normal range, you have disadvantage on the attack roll. You can't attack a target beyond the weapon's long range.

properties.name: Two-Handed
properties.description: This weapon requires two hands when you attack with it.

definition.name: Backpack
definition.description:
A backpack is a leather pack carried on the back, typically with straps to secure it. A backpack can hold 1 cubic foot/ 30 pounds of gear.

You can also strap items, such as a bedroll or a coil of rope, to the outside of a backpack.

definition.name: Blanket
definition.description: A thick, quilted, blanket made to keep you warm in cold weather.

definition.name: Clothes, Common
definition.description: This set of clothes could consist of a loose shirt and baggy breeches, or a loose shirt and skirt or overdress. Cloth wrappings are used for shoes.

definition.name: Quiver
definition.description: A quiver can hold up to 20 arrows.

definition.name: Herbalism Kit
definition.description: This kit contains a variety of instruments such as clippers, mortar and pestle, and pouches and vials used by herbalists to create remedies and potions. Proficiency with this kit lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to identify or apply herbs. Also, proficiency with this kit is required to create antitoxin and any potion of healing.

definition.name: Rations (1 day)
definition.description: Rations consist of dry foods suitable for extended travel, including jerky, dried fruit, hardtack, and nuts.

definition.name: Azurite
definition.description: An opaque mottled deep blue gemstone worth 10 gold pieces

definition.name: Moonstone
definition.description: A translucent white gemstone with a pale blue glow worth 50 gold pieces.

definition.name: Zircon
definition.description: A transparent pale blue-green gemstone worth 50 gold pieces.

definition.name: Amber
definition.description: A transparent watery gold to rich gold gemstone worth 100 gold pieces.

definition.name: Lapis Lazuli
definition.description: An opaque light and dark blue gemstone with yellow flecks worth 10 gold pieces.

definition.name: Amethyst
definition.description: A transparent deep purple gemstone worth 100 gold pieces.

definition.name: Blue quartz
definition.description: A transparent pale blue gemstone worth 10 gold pieces

definition.name: Moss agate
definition.description: A translucent gemstone with pink or yellow-white with mossy gray or green markings worth 10 gold pieces

definition.name: Rhodochrosite
definition.description: An opaque light pink gemstone worth 10 gold pieces

definition.name: Sardonyx
definition.description: An opaque gemstone with bands of red and white worth 50 gold pieces.

definition.name: Malachite
definition.description: An opaque striated light and dark green gemstone worth 10 gold pieces

definition.name: Obsidian
definition.description: An opaque black gemstone worth 10 gold pieces

definition.name: Tiger Eye
definition.description: A translucent brown gemstone with a golden center worth 10 gold pieces

definition.name: Jade
definition.description: A translucent light green, deep green, or white gemstone worth 100 gold pieces

definition.name: Turquoise
definition.description: An opaque light blue-green gemstone worth 10 gold pieces

definition.name: Carnelian
definition.description: An opaque orange to red-brown gemstone worth 50 gold pieces

definition.name: Citrine
definition.description: A transparent pale yellow-brown gemstone worth 50 gold pieces

definition.name: Chrysoberyl
definition.description: A transparent yellow-green to pale green gemstone worth 100 gold pieces

definition.name: Coral
definition.description: An opaque crimson gemstone worth 100 gold pieces

definition.name: Bedroll
definition.description: You never know where you’re going to sleep, and a bedroll helps you get better sleep in a hayloft or on the cold ground. A bedroll consists of bedding and a blanket thin enough to be rolled up and tied. In an emergency, it can double as a stretcher.

definition.name: Mess Kit
definition.description: This tin box contains a cup and simple cutlery. The box clamps together, and one side can be used as a cooking pan and the other as a plate or shallow bowl.

definition.name: Rope, Hempen (50 feet)
definition.description: Rope, has 2 hit points and can be burst with a DC 17 Strength check.

definition.name: Tinderbox
definition.description: This small container holds flint, fire steel, and tinder (usually dry cloth soaked in light oil) used to kindle a fire. Using it to light a torch -- or anything else with abundant, exposed fuel -- takes an action. Lighting any other fire takes 1 minute.

definition.name: Torch
definition.description: A torch burns for 1 hour, providing bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. If you make a melee attack with a burning torch and hit, it deals 1 fire damage.

definition.name: Waterskin
definition.description: A waterskin can hold 4 pints of liquid.

definition.name: Antitoxin
definition.description: A creature that drinks this vial of liquid gains advantage on saving throws against poison for 1 hour. It confers no benefit to undead or constructs.

definition.name: Arrows
definition.description: Arrows are used with a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack (you need a free hand to load a one-handed weapon). At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

definition.name: Monk
definition.description:
A master of martial arts, harnessing the power of the body in pursuit of physical and spiritual perfection

Hit Die: d8
Primary Ability: Dexterity & Wisdom
Saves: Strength & Dexterity
definition.equipmentDescription:
You start with the following equipment, in addition to the equipment granted by your background:

  • (a) a shortsword or (b) any simple weapon
  • (a) a dungeoneer’s pack or (b) an explorer’s pack
  • 10 darts

classFeatures.name: Unarmored Defense
classFeatures.description: Beginning at 1st level, while you are wearing no armor and not wielding a shield, your AC equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Wisdom modifier.

classFeatures.name: Martial Arts
classFeatures.description:
At 1st level, your practice of martial arts gives you mastery of combat styles that use unarmed strikes and monk weapons, which are shortswords and any simple melee weapons that don’t have the two-handed or heavy property.

You gain the following benefits while you are unarmed or wielding only monk weapons and you aren’t wearing armor or wielding a shield:

  • You can use Dexterity instead of Strength for the attack and damage rolls of your unarmed strikes and monk weapons.
  • You can roll a d4 in place of the normal damage of your unarmed strike or monk weapon. This die changes as you gain monk levels, as shown in the Martial Arts column of the Monk table.
  • When you use the Attack action with an unarmed strike or a monk weapon on your turn, you can make one unarmed strike as a bonus action. For example, if you take the Attack action and attack with a quarterstaff, you can also make an unarmed strike as a bonus action, assuming you haven’t already taken a bonus action this turn.

Certain monasteries use specialized forms of the monk weapons. For example, you might use a club that is two lengths of wood connected by a short chain (called a nunchaku) or a sickle with a shorter, straighter blade (called a kama). Whatever name you use for a monk weapon, you can use the game statistics provided for the weapon in the Weapons section.

classFeatures.name: Ki
classFeatures.description:
Starting at 2nd level, your training allows you to harness the mystic energy of ki. Your access to this energy is represented by a number of ki points. Your monk level determines the number of points you have, as shown in the Ki Points column of the Monk table.

You can spend these points to fuel various ki features. You start knowing three such features: Flurry of Blows, Patient Defense, and Step of the Wind. You learn more ki features as you gain levels in this class.

When you spend a ki point, it is unavailable until you finish a short or long rest, at the end of which you draw all of your expended ki back into yourself. You must spend at least 30 minutes of the rest meditating to regain your ki points.

Some of your ki features require your target to make a saving throw to resist the feature’s effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:

Ki save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier

Flurry of Blows

Immediately after you take the Attack action on your turn, you can spend 1 ki point to make two unarmed strikes as a bonus action.

Patient Defense

You can spend 1 ki point to take the Dodge action as a bonus action on your turn.

Step of the Wind

You can spend 1 ki point to take the Disengage or Dash action as a bonus action on your turn, and your jump distance is doubled for the turn.

classFeatures.name: Unarmored Movement
classFeatures.description:
Starting at 2nd level, your speed increases by 10 feet while you are not wearing armor or wielding a shield. This bonus increases when you reach certain monk levels, as shown in the Monk table.

At 9th level, you gain the ability to move along vertical surfaces and across liquids on your turn without falling during the move.

classFeatures.name: Monastic Tradition
classFeatures.description: When you reach 3rd level, you commit yourself to a monastic tradition: the Way of the Open Hand, detailed at the end of the class description or one from another source. Your tradition grants you features at 3rd level and again at 6th, 11th, and 17th level.

classFeatures.name: Deflect Missiles
classFeatures.description:
Starting at 3rd level, you can use your reaction to deflect or catch the missile when you are hit by a ranged weapon attack. When you do so, the damage you take from the attack is reduced by 1d10 + your Dexterity modifier + your monk level.

If you reduce the damage to 0, you can catch the missile if it is small enough for you to hold in one hand and you have at least one hand free. If you catch a missile in this way, you can spend 1 ki point to make a ranged attack with the weapon or piece of ammunition you just caught, as part of the same reaction. You make this attack with proficiency, regardless of your weapon proficiencies, and the missile counts as a monk weapon for the attack, which has a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet.

classFeatures.name: Ability Score Improvement
classFeatures.description:
When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

Using the optional feats rule, you can forgo taking this feature to take a feat of your choice instead.

classFeatures.name: Slow Fall
classFeatures.description: Beginning at 4th level, you can use your reaction when you fall to reduce any falling damage you take by an amount equal to five times your monk level.

classFeatures.name: Extra Attack
classFeatures.description: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

classFeatures.name: Stunning Strike
classFeatures.description: Starting at 5th level, you can interfere with the flow of ki in an opponent’s body. When you hit another creature with a melee weapon attack, you can spend 1 ki point to attempt a stunning strike. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of your next turn.

classFeatures.name: Ki-Empowered Strikes
classFeatures.description: Starting at 6th level, your unarmed strikes count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

classFeatures.name: Evasion
classFeatures.description: At 7th level, your instinctive agility lets you dodge out of the way of certain area effects, such as a blue dragon’s lightning breath or a fireball spell. When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

classFeatures.name: Stillness of Mind
classFeatures.description: Starting at 7th level, you can use your action to end one effect on yourself that is causing you to be charmed or frightened.

classFeatures.name: Purity of Body
classFeatures.description: At 10th level, your mastery of the ki flowing through you makes you immune to disease and poison.

classFeatures.name: Tongue of the Sun and Moon
classFeatures.description: Starting at 13th level, you learn to touch the ki of other minds so that you understand all spoken languages. Moreover, any creature that can understand a language can understand what you say.

classFeatures.name: Diamond Soul
classFeatures.description:
Beginning at 14th level, your mastery of ki grants you proficiency in all saving throws.

Additionally, whenever you make a saving throw and fail, you can spend 1 ki point to reroll it and take the second result.

classFeatures.name: Timeless Body
classFeatures.description: At 15th level, your ki sustains you so that you suffer none of the frailty of old age, and you can’t be aged magically. You can still die of old age, however. In addition, you no longer need food or water.

classFeatures.name: Empty Body
classFeatures.description:
Beginning at 18th level, you can use your action to spend 4 ki points to become invisible for 1 minute. During that time, you also have resistance to all damage but force damage.

Additionally, you can spend 8 ki points to cast the astral projection spell, without needing material components. When you do so, you can’t take any other creatures with you.

classFeatures.name: Perfect Self
classFeatures.description: At 20th level, when you roll for initiative and have no ki points remaining, you regain 4 ki points.

classFeatures.name: Unarmored Movement Improvement
classFeatures.description: At 9th level, you gain the ability to move along vertical surfaces and across liquids on your turn without falling during your move.

classFeatures.name: Ability Score Improvement
classFeatures.description:
When you reach 8th level, and again at 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

Using the optional feats rule, you can forgo taking this feature to take a feat of your choice instead.

classFeatures.name: Ability Score Improvement
classFeatures.description:
When you reach 12th level, and again at 16th and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

Using the optional feats rule, you can forgo taking this feature to take a feat of your choice instead.

classFeatures.name: Ability Score Improvement
classFeatures.description:
When you reach 16th level, and again at 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

Using the optional feats rule, you can forgo taking this feature to take a feat of your choice instead.

classFeatures.name: Ability Score Improvement
classFeatures.description:
When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

Using the optional feats rule, you can forgo taking this feature to take a feat of your choice instead.

classFeatures.name: Unarmored Movement
classFeatures.description: At 6th level, your Unarmored Speed speed bonus increases to 15 feet while you are not wearing armor or wielding a shield.

classFeatures.name: Unarmored Movement
classFeatures.description: At 10th level, your Unarmored Speed speed bonus increases to 20 feet while you are not wearing armor or wielding a shield.

classFeatures.name: Unarmored Movement
classFeatures.description: At 14th level, your Unarmored Speed speed bonus increases to 25 feet while you are not wearing armor or wielding a shield.

classFeatures.name: Unarmored Movement
classFeatures.description: At 18th level, your Unarmored Speed speed bonus increases to 30 feet while you are not wearing armor or wielding a shield.

classFeatures.name: Proficiencies
classFeatures.description:
Armor: None
Weapons: Simple weapons, shortswords
Tools: Choose one type of artisan’s tools or one musical instrument
Saving Throws: Strength, Dexterity
Skills: Choose two from Acrobatics, Athletics, History, Insight, Religion, and Stealth

classFeatures.name: Hit Points
classFeatures.description:
Hit Dice: 1d8 per monk level
Hit Points at 1st Level: 8 + your Constitution modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d8 (or 5) + your Constitution modifier per monk level after 1st

subclassDefinition.name: Way of Mercy
subclassDefinition.description: Monks of the Way of Mercy learn to manipulate the life force of others to bring aid to those in need. They are wandering physicians to the poor and hurt. However, to those beyond their help, they bring a swift end as an act of mercy.

classFeatures.name: Implements of Mercy
classFeatures.description:
3rd-level Way of Mercy feature

You gain proficiency in the Insight and Medicine skills, and you gain proficiency with the herbalism kit. You also gain a special mask, which you often wear when using the features of this subclass. You determine its appearance, or generate it randomly by rolling on the Merciful Mask table.

Merciful Mask
d6 Mask Appearance
1 Raven
2 Blank and white
3 Crying visage
4 Laughing visage
5 Skull
6 Butterfly

classFeatures.name: Hand of Healing
classFeatures.description:
3rd-level Way of Mercy feature

Your mystical touch can mend wounds. As an action, you can spend 1 ki point to touch a creature and restore a number of hit points equal to a roll of your Martial Arts die + your Wisdom modifier.

When you use your Flurry of Blows, you can replace one of the unarmed strikes with a use of this feature without spending a ki point for the healing.

classFeatures.name: Hand of Harm
classFeatures.description:
3rd-level Way of Mercy feature

You use your ki to inflict wounds. When you hit a creature with an unarmed strike, you can spend 1 ki point to deal extra necrotic damage equal to one roll of your Martial Arts die + your Wisdom modifier. You can use this feature only once per turn.

classFeatures.name: Physician’s Touch
classFeatures.description:
6th-level Way of Mercy feature

You can administer even greater cures with a touch, and if you feel it’s necessary, you can use your knowledge to cause harm.

When you use Hand of Healing on a creature, you can also end one disease or one of the following conditions affecting the creature: blinded, deafened, paralyzed, poisoned, or stunned.

When you use Hand of Harm on a creature, you can subject that creature to the poisoned condition until the end of your next turn.

classFeatures.name: Flurry of Healing and Harm
classFeatures.description:
11th-level Way of Mercy feature

You can now mete out a flurry of comfort and hurt. When you use Flurry of Blows, you can now replace each of the unarmed strikes with a use of your Hand of Healing, without spending ki points for the healing.

In addition, when you make an unarmed strike with Flurry of Blows, you can use Hand of Harm with that strike without spending the ki point for Hand of Harm. You can still use Hand of Harm only once per turn.

classFeatures.name: Hand of Ultimate Mercy
classFeatures.description:
17th-level Way of Mercy feature

Your mastery of life energy opens the door to the ultimate mercy. As an action, you can touch the corpse of a creature that died within the past 24 hours and expend 5 ki points. The creature then returns to life, regaining a number of hit points equal to 4d10 + your Wisdom modifier. If the creature died while subject to any of the following conditions, it revives with them removed: blinded, deafened, paralyzed, poisoned, and stunned.

Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.

classFeatures.name: Unarmored Defense
classFeatures.description: Beginning at 1st level, while you are wearing no armor and not wielding a shield, your AC equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Wisdom modifier.

classFeatures.name: Martial Arts
classFeatures.description:
At 1st level, your practice of martial arts gives you mastery of combat styles that use unarmed strikes and monk weapons, which are shortswords and any simple melee weapons that don’t have the two-handed or heavy property.

You gain the following benefits while you are unarmed or wielding only monk weapons and you aren’t wearing armor or wielding a shield:

  • You can use Dexterity instead of Strength for the attack and damage rolls of your unarmed strikes and monk weapons.
  • You can roll a d4 in place of the normal damage of your unarmed strike or monk weapon. This die changes as you gain monk levels, as shown in the Martial Arts column of the Monk table.
  • When you use the Attack action with an unarmed strike or a monk weapon on your turn, you can make one unarmed strike as a bonus action. For example, if you take the Attack action and attack with a quarterstaff, you can also make an unarmed strike as a bonus action, assuming you haven’t already taken a bonus action this turn.

Certain monasteries use specialized forms of the monk weapons. For example, you might use a club that is two lengths of wood connected by a short chain (called a nunchaku) or a sickle with a shorter, straighter blade (called a kama). Whatever name you use for a monk weapon, you can use the game statistics provided for the weapon in the Weapons section.

classFeatures.name: Ki
classFeatures.description:
Starting at 2nd level, your training allows you to harness the mystic energy of ki. Your access to this energy is represented by a number of ki points. Your monk level determines the number of points you have, as shown in the Ki Points column of the Monk table.

You can spend these points to fuel various ki features. You start knowing three such features: Flurry of Blows, Patient Defense, and Step of the Wind. You learn more ki features as you gain levels in this class.

When you spend a ki point, it is unavailable until you finish a short or long rest, at the end of which you draw all of your expended ki back into yourself. You must spend at least 30 minutes of the rest meditating to regain your ki points.

Some of your ki features require your target to make a saving throw to resist the feature’s effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:

Ki save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier

Flurry of Blows

Immediately after you take the Attack action on your turn, you can spend 1 ki point to make two unarmed strikes as a bonus action.

Patient Defense

You can spend 1 ki point to take the Dodge action as a bonus action on your turn.

Step of the Wind

You can spend 1 ki point to take the Disengage or Dash action as a bonus action on your turn, and your jump distance is doubled for the turn.

classFeatures.name: Unarmored Movement
classFeatures.description:
Starting at 2nd level, your speed increases by 10 feet while you are not wearing armor or wielding a shield. This bonus increases when you reach certain monk levels, as shown in the Monk table.

At 9th level, you gain the ability to move along vertical surfaces and across liquids on your turn without falling during the move.

classFeatures.name: Monastic Tradition
classFeatures.description: When you reach 3rd level, you commit yourself to a monastic tradition: the Way of the Open Hand, detailed at the end of the class description or one from another source. Your tradition grants you features at 3rd level and again at 6th, 11th, and 17th level.

classFeatures.name: Deflect Missiles
classFeatures.description:
Starting at 3rd level, you can use your reaction to deflect or catch the missile when you are hit by a ranged weapon attack. When you do so, the damage you take from the attack is reduced by 1d10 + your Dexterity modifier + your monk level.

If you reduce the damage to 0, you can catch the missile if it is small enough for you to hold in one hand and you have at least one hand free. If you catch a missile in this way, you can spend 1 ki point to make a ranged attack with the weapon or piece of ammunition you just caught, as part of the same reaction. You make this attack with proficiency, regardless of your weapon proficiencies, and the missile counts as a monk weapon for the attack, which has a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet.

Using the optional feats rule, you can forgo taking this feature to take a feat of your choice instead.

definition.name: Extra Attack
definition.description: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.
definition.snippet: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.
definition.multiClassDescription:
This feature could be affected by multiclassing. See the Multiclassing rules for more information.

Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

definition.name: Stunning Strike
definition.description: Starting at 5th level, you can interfere with the flow of ki in an opponent’s body. When you hit another creature with a melee weapon attack, you can spend 1 ki point to attempt a stunning strike. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of your next turn.
definition.snippet: When you hit with a melee weapon attack, you can spend 1 ki point to make the target stunned until the end of your next turn if it fails a CON saving throw (DC {{savedc:wis}}).

definition.name: Ki-Empowered Strikes
definition.description: Starting at 6th level, your unarmed strikes count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.
definition.snippet: Your unarmed strikes count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity.

definition.name: Evasion
definition.description: At 7th level, your instinctive agility lets you dodge out of the way of certain area effects, such as a blue dragon’s lightning breath or a fireball spell. When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.
definition.snippet: When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a DEX saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

definition.name: Stillness of Mind
definition.description: Starting at 7th level, you can use your action to end one effect on yourself that is causing you to be charmed or frightened.
definition.snippet: You can use an action to end one effect on yourself that is causing you to be charmed or frightened.

definition.name: Purity of Body
definition.description: At 10th level, your mastery of the ki flowing through you makes you immune to disease and poison.
definition.snippet: You are immune to disease and poison.

definition.name: Tongue of the Sun and Moon
definition.description: Starting at 13th level, you learn to touch the ki of other minds so that you understand all spoken languages. Moreover, any creature that can understand a language can understand what you say.
definition.snippet: You understand all spoken languages and any creature that can understand a language can understand what you say.

definition.name: Diamond Soul
definition.description:
Beginning at 14th level, your mastery of ki grants you proficiency in all saving throws.

Additionally, whenever you make a saving throw and fail, you can spend 1 ki point to reroll it and take the second result.
definition.snippet: You are proficient in all saving throws and whenever you make a saving throw and fail, you can spend 1 ki point to reroll it and take the second result.

definition.name: Timeless Body
definition.description: At 15th level, your ki sustains you so that you suffer none of the frailty of old age, and you can’t be aged magically. You can still die of old age, however. In addition, you no longer need food or water.
definition.snippet: You no longer need food or water, and can't be aged magically or suffer effects of old age (though you can still die of it).

definition.name: Empty Body
definition.description:
Beginning at 18th level, you can use your action to spend 4 ki points to become invisible for 1 minute. During that time, you also have resistance to all damage but force damage.

Additionally, you can spend 8 ki points to cast the astral projection spell, without needing material components. When you do so, you can’t take any other creatures with you.
definition.snippet: You can spend 4 ki points to become invisible and gain resistance to all damage but force damage for 1 minute as an action. You can spend 8 ki points to cast the astral projection spell (for yourself only), without needing material components.

definition.name: Perfect Self
definition.description: At 20th level, when you roll for initiative and have no ki points remaining, you regain 4 ki points.
definition.snippet: When you roll for initiative and have no ki points remaining, you regain 4 ki points.

definition.name: Unarmored Movement Improvement
definition.description: At 9th level, you gain the ability to move along vertical surfaces and across liquids on your turn without falling during your move.
definition.snippet: You can move along vertical surfaces and across liquids on your turn without falling during the move.

definition.name: Ability Score Improvement
definition.description:
When you reach 8th level, and again at 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

Using the optional feats rule, you can forgo taking this feature to take a feat of your choice instead.

definition.name: Ability Score Improvement
definition.description:
When you reach 12th level, and again at 16th and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

Using the optional feats rule, you can forgo taking this feature to take a feat of your choice instead.

definition.name: Ability Score Improvement
definition.description:
When you reach 16th level, and again at 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

Using the optional feats rule, you can forgo taking this feature to take a feat of your choice instead.

definition.name: Ability Score Improvement
definition.description:
When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

Using the optional feats rule, you can forgo taking this feature to take a feat of your choice instead.

definition.name: Unarmored Movement
definition.description: At 6th level, your Unarmored Speed speed bonus increases to 15 feet while you are not wearing armor or wielding a shield.
definition.snippet: Your speed increases by 15 feet while you are not wearing armor or wielding a shield.

definition.name: Unarmored Movement
definition.description: At 10th level, your Unarmored Speed speed bonus increases to 20 feet while you are not wearing armor or wielding a shield.
definition.snippet: Your speed increases by 20 feet while you are not wearing armor or wielding a shield.

definition.name: Unarmored Movement
definition.description: At 14th level, your Unarmored Speed speed bonus increases to 25 feet while you are not wearing armor or wielding a shield.
definition.snippet: Your speed increases by 25 feet while you are not wearing armor or wielding a shield.

definition.name: Unarmored Movement
definition.description: At 18th level, your Unarmored Speed speed bonus increases to 30 feet while you are not wearing armor or wielding a shield.
definition.snippet: Your speed increases by 30 feet while you are not wearing armor or wielding a shield.

definition.name: Proficiencies
definition.description:
Armor: None
Weapons: Simple weapons, shortswords
Tools: Choose one type of artisan’s tools or one musical instrument
Saving Throws: Strength, Dexterity
Skills: Choose two from Acrobatics, Athletics, History, Insight, Religion, and Stealth

definition.name: Hit Points
definition.description:
Hit Dice: 1d8 per monk level
Hit Points at 1st Level: 8 + your Constitution modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d8 (or 5) + your Constitution modifier per monk level after 1st

definition.name: Mobile
definition.description:
You are exceptionally speedy and agile. You gain the following benefits:

  • Your speed increases by 10 feet.
  • When you use the Dash action, difficult terrain doesn't cost you extra movement on that turn.
  • When you make a melee attack against a creature, you don't provoke opportunity attacks from that creature for the rest of the turn, whether you hit or not.
definition.snippet: Your speed increases by 10 feet. When you use the Dash action, difficult terrain doesn't cost you extra movement on that turn. When you make a melee attack against a creature, you don't provoke opportunity attacks from that creature for the rest of the turn, whether you hit or not.

definition.name: Skill Expert
definition.description:
You have honed your proficiency with particular skills, granting you the following benefits:

  • Increase one ability score of your choice by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency in one skill of your choice.
  • Choose one skill in which you have proficiency. You gain expertise with that skill, which means your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make with it. The skill you choose must be one that isn’t already benefiting from a feature, such as Expertise, that doubles your proficiency bonus.
definition.snippet: You gain proficiency in a skill. You also gain expertise in a skill which you are already proficient in.

definition.name: Increase two scores (+2 / +1)
definition.description: increase one of those scores by 2 and increase a different score by 1.

race.label: Choose an Ability Score to increase by 2
Choose an Ability Score to increase by 1

class.label: Choose a Musical Instrument or Artisan's Tools

options.label: Increase two scores (+2 / +1)
options.description: increase one of those scores by 2 and increase a different score by 1.

class.name: Unarmed Strike
class.description: Bonus action, when you use the [action]Attack[/action] action with an unarmed strike or a monk weapon.
class.snippet: When you use the Attack action with an unarmed strike or a monk weapon on your turn, you can make one unarmed strike as a bonus action.

class.name: Ki Points
class.snippet: You can spend Ki Points to fuel ki features. You have {{limiteduse}} points per short rest and your Ki save DC is {{savedc:wis}}.

class.name: Flurry of Blows
class.snippet: After you take the Attack action on your turn, you can spend 1 ki point to make two unarmed strikes as a bonus action.

class.name: Patient Defense
class.snippet: You can spend 1 ki point to take the Dodge action as a bonus action on your turn.

class.name: Step of the Wind
class.snippet: You can spend 1 ki point to take the Disengage or Dash action as a bonus action on your turn, and your jump distance is doubled for the turn.

class.name: Deflect Missiles
class.description:
Starting at 3rd level, you can use your reaction to deflect or catch the missile when you are hit by a ranged weapon attack. When you do so, the damage you take from the attack is reduced by 1d10 + your Dexterity modifier + your monk level.

If you reduce the damage to 0, you can catch the missile if it is small enough for you to hold in one hand and you have at least one hand free. If you catch a missile in this way, you can spend 1 ki point to make a ranged attack with the weapon or piece of ammunition you just caught, as part of the same reaction. You make this attack with proficiency, regardless of your weapon proficiencies, and the missile counts as a monk weapon for the attack, which has a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet.
class.snippet: You can use your reaction to deflect or catch the missile when you are hit by a ranged weapon attack. When you do so, the damage you take from the attack is reduced by 1d10 {{(modifier:dex+classlevel)#signed}}. If you reduce damage to 0 and have a free hand, you can spend 1 ki point to make a ranged attack (as with a monk weapon) with a range of 20/60.

class.name: Deflect Missiles Attack
class.snippet: If you reduce damage to 0 and have a free hand, you can spend 1 ki point to make a ranged attack (as with a monk weapon).

class.name: Slow Fall
class.snippet: You can use your reaction when you fall to reduce any falling damage you take by {{classlevel*5#unsigned}}.

class.name: Stunning Strike
class.snippet: When you hit with a melee weapon attack, you can spend 1 ki point to make the target stunned until the end of your next turn if it fails a CON saving throw (DC {{savedc:wis}}).

class.name: Stillness of Mind
class.snippet: You can use an action to end one effect on yourself that is causing you to be charmed or frightened.

class.name: Hand of Healing
class.description:
3rd-level Way of Mercy feature

Your mystical touch can mend wounds. As an action, you can spend 1 ki point to touch a creature and restore a number of hit points equal to a roll of your Martial Arts die + your Wisdom modifier.

When you use your Flurry of Blows, you can replace one of the unarmed strikes with a use of this feature without spending a ki point for the healing.
class.snippet: As an action, you can spend 1 ki point to touch a creature and restore {{scalevalue}}{{modifier:wis#signed}} hit points. When you use your Flurry of Blows, you can replace one of the unarmed strikes with a use of this feature without spending a ki point for the healing.

class.name: Hand of Harm
class.description:
3rd-level Way of Mercy feature

You use your ki to inflict wounds. When you hit a creature with an unarmed strike, you can spend 1 ki point to deal extra necrotic damage equal to one roll of your Martial Arts die + your Wisdom modifier. You can use this feature only once per turn.
class.snippet: When you hit a creature with an unarmed strike, you can spend 1 ki point to deal extra {{scalevalue}}{{modifier:wis#signed}} necrotic damage. You can use this feature only once per turn.

class.name: Ki-Fueled Attack
class.description:
3rd-level monk feature
If you spend 1 ki point or more as part of your action on your turn, you can make one attack with an unarmed strike or a monk weapon as a bonus action before the end of the turn.
class.snippet: If you spend 1 ki point or more as part of your action on your turn, you can make one attack with an unarmed strike or a monk weapon as a bonus action before the end of the turn.

class.name: Quickened Healing
class.description:
4th-level monk feature
As an action, you can spend 2 ki points and roll a Martial Arts die. You regain a number of hit points equal to the number rolled plus your proficiency bonus.
class.snippet: As an action, you can spend 2 ki points to regain {{scalevalue}}{{proficiency#signed}} hit points.

class.name: Focused Aim
class.description:
5th-level monk feature
When you miss with an attack roll, you can spend 1 to 3 ki points to increase your attack roll by 2 for each of these ki points you spend, potentially turning the miss into a hit.
class.snippet: When you miss with an attack roll, you can spend 1-3 ki points to increase your attack roll by 2 for each of these ki points you spend, potentially turning the miss into a hit.

class.name: Physician’s Touch
class.description:
6th-level Way of Mercy feature

You can administer even greater cures with a touch, and if you feel it’s necessary, you can use your knowledge to cause harm.

When you use Hand of Healing on a creature, you can also end one disease or one of the following conditions affecting the creature: [condition]blinded[/condition], [condition]deafened[/condition], [condition]paralyzed[/condition], [condition]poisoned[/condition], or [condition]stunned[/condition].

When you use Hand of Harm on a creature, you can subject that creature to the [condition]poisoned[/condition] condition until the end of your next turn.
class.snippet:
When you use Hand of Healing on a creature, you can also end one disease or one of the following conditions affecting the creature: blinded, deafened, paralyzed, poisoned, or stunned.
When you use Hand of Harm on a creature, you can subject that creature to the poisoned condition until the end of your next turn.

race.restriction: You can’t use this flying speed if you’re wearing medium or heavy armor.

customItems.description: Lyste och spelade musik en gång i tiden men slutade innan vi dödade en zarkofag lord.

customItems.description: Har en utskärning för en fladdermus amulett
